name: Grey's Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Brighton and we stayed for a weekend. Grey's Hotel is in a fantastic location in Kemp Town, which is very vibrant, as well as being close to the beach.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel in a Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received a warm welcome and our room was brilliant - stylish, comfortable and very clean. The breakfast was amazing and it was so generous we didn't need lunch! The owners are very friendly and gave us fantastic advice about good local restaurants. We had a great time and we would happily stay there again.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, immaculate and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: My partner took me here for my 30th. It is a fantastic hotel, really clean with nice touches -like White stuff shampoo and white bath robes. Located in Kemp Town near lots of great pubs and places to eat - good and cheap Thai food just down the road. The owner was really friendly and had good recommendations about stuff to do in Brighton. Good breakfasts and lots of choice with veggie options.
reviews.title: More than a B&B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Greys for three days for a conference in Brighton. The booking was made by my office so I had no idea what to expect. All I can say is that this is no B&B! This is a five-star hotel with a big heart. Comfortable, even luxurious, warm and friendly, with the most amazing breakfasts you can imagine. The guys who run Greys are great, with loads of advice on places to visit and eat. I hope to return soon - who minds working away when you can come home to this.
reviews.title: A lovely, clean B&B located seconds from the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having searched for hours looking for an ideal place to take my girlfriend for our three year anniversary, i came across Greys hotel. It was well priced and the location seemed ideal as it was a 30 second walk to the seafront.
reviews.title: A refreshing, luxurious stay & perfect weekend away!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Never been to Brighton before, What a wonder place. Decided to get to Brighton after a recommendation from a close family friend had a wonderful time.
reviews.title: Brighton Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Husband and wife with teenagers, well we needed to get away for a weekend, decided to review Greys Hotel website, photos descriptions look great, I know it can be deceiving on some sites ,marketing a business, but I can honestly say, it was 'FANTASTIC'.
reviews.title: perfect weekend break, great service and lovely breakfasts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Terry was a brilliant host, welcoming, helpful, but most of all the place was spotless.
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: The rooms were of a very high standard, the bedding, covers decor etc were high quality.
reviews.title: Refreshing Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then came Brighton itself, GET DOWN THERE, Start living again.
reviews.title: Bed of Roses

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a visit to Britain in February we decided to take a couple of days in Brighton, and based on Tripadvisor reviews chose Grey's for our stay. I have to say that there isn't much more I can add to the already glowing reports – the place is every bit as fabulous as they say. The boys work very hard to make you feel at home and nothing seems too much bother. The rooms are lovely and clean with gorgeous, crisp white bed linen, while the breakfasts are simply amazing! Try the eggs benedict!
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009
reviews.text: On an exceptionally chilly January weekend, Mum and I were delighted to find the warmest of welcomes at Grey's Hotel. Terry and the boys were friendly and anxious to make us comfortable, and we were upgraded to double rooms on arrival. The rooms were spotless and the breakfast outstanding, with free-range eggs, bacon and sausages, of which we took full advantage. I would definitely go back any time.
reviews.title: A warm welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grey's Hotel is a lovely and well designed property. It is situated on a quiet street away from the madness of the main street in Brighton but just a short walk from the Lanes, the pier and the Royal Pavilion.
reviews.title: Small but perfectly formed

likes.disliked: — King size bed would be preferable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008
reviews.text: The rooms are relatively small but cosy and very well and luxuriously decorated - we particularly noted the plush carpets throughout. Bathrooms are also small but shower pressure is good and they are supplied with high quality White Company products.
reviews.title: Fantastic place - highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008
reviews.text: Breakfasts are excellent with a great selection of fruit and cereals, warm croissants fresh from the oven and cooked breakfast available.
reviews.title: A Real Birthday Treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a wonderful time whilst staying at Greys. It is in a central location situated inbetween the centre of town and the Marina, both 10 minutes walking distance away from the hotel. The room was extremely clean and tidy, and the large rooms boast a four post bed. The breakfast was beautiful with a choice of cereals, cooked breakfast and the offer of a continental breakfast. The staff were very polite and pleasant and could not have been more helpful. Terry was an excellent host and was quick to help us with anything that we needed. All in all the hotel added to our great stay in Brighton and we will most definately be returning!
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I have been to!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Grey's hotel is the perfect place to stay for a weekend away in Brighton. I stayed there with some friends and we found the hotel to be ideal to cater for our needs. Its location is great, 1 minute from the beach and 10 minutes from Brighton pier. Which enables you to have a lovely walk along the seaside as you go into town. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable, also having a contemporary feel. The staff were really polite and very helpful. Grey's was extremely good value for money. We thought we paid a low price for a hotel of this quality. And I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Brighton in the near future.
reviews.title: Ideal hotel for weekend away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I travel considerably and many hotels disappoint with tatty rooms, poor service and awful value for money. Grey's delivers on every level, except for parking - although, very few hotels in Brighton come with parking.
reviews.title: Outstanding, cosy, friendly and i will be back there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a couple of nights before Easter and the room was lovely and spacious with a four poster bed (Superior room) and 2 comfy (elegant) seats by the window over looking the street with the sea 150m away. Only a 10 minute walk to the lanes. The breakfast was superb, either the full English, or Vegetarian, or our favourite: Eggs Benedict. TV had the usual freeview TV but there was a load of DVDs which you could borrow. We have stayed at another (bigger) hotel last year which had a room half the size for nearly double the price and was very noisy. Grey's was definately a little gem. If we go back to Brighton, we will definately return.
reviews.title: Spacious rooms with all mod cons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Ideally located for both the seafront and the the excellent shopping - The Lanes is the place to go for quaint shops and historical architecture. Both areas are a short walking distance from the hotel.
reviews.title: Check out the bedrooms of individual style and a breakfast to die for

description: Grey's is situated in the heart of Brighton, offering luxury accommodation and excellent service at affordable prices. Our rooms are all individually designed and boast flat-screen TVs, Senseo coffee/tea makers, White Company toiletries and white Egyptian cotton bed linen. We are located just 6-7 minutes walk away from the centre and its many restaurants and shops, and a stone's throw from the beach.
